mdRecord.dcterms:title: Newer ideals of peace / by Jane Addams
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Addams, Jane, 1860-1935
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Introduction.--Survivals of militarism in city government.--Failure to utilize immigrants in city government.--Militarism and industrial legislation.--Group morality in the labor movement.--Protection of children for industrial efficiency.--Utilization of women in city government.--Passing of the war virtues.
Series title also at head of t.-p.
"Parts of two chapters have been published before in the form of addresses, and two others as articles in the North American review and in the American journal of sociology."--Pref. note.

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Original maroon cloth; backstrip repaired with maroon tape; text block detached. Inscribed "Edwin A. Alderman. University of Va. 1907" on front pastedown. From the Library of Edwin A. Alderman, with his bookplate.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The citizen's library of economics, politics, and sociology
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Alderman, Edwin Anderson, 1861-1931--Library--Personal copy.
Municipal government--United States.
